data.title: Pat Thomas on LinkedIn: Citizens of Los Angeles! after 3 long years
data.meta_description:
Citizens of Los Angeles!
after 3 long years - I'm returning to hosting author events at Book Soup in Los Angeles! This one also celebrates my birthday on…
data.text:
I’m honored to have been the ‘behind the scenes’ person to organize this forthcoming album to be released via Fire Records; Lone Justice with Maria McKee, Ryan Hedgecock, Marvin Etzioni and Don Heffington announce 'Viva Lone Justice' the first new album to be released by the band in 40 years, with unearthed never heard before music. Includes the new single ‘Teenage Kicks'/ LP & CD (out 25th October) Through the advent of technology, sweat and tears, a new Lone Justice album has now been completed. Their finest work to date. Special guests include string arranger Tammy Rogers, multi-horn player David Ralicke, Greg Leisz on steel guitar and Benmont Tench on piano.

I'm bringing my recent Allen Ginsberg book back to San Francisco for an encore performance - plus screening a 1971 Ginsberg with Jerry Rubin movie that you've NEVER seen before - it's a FREE event ! https://lnkd.in/gxQ7ruG9

Rochester, NY - I'm coming to your town, I'll help you party down - Thursday June 20th 6 to 8 pm at the Record Archive - it's a FREE event - we'll discuss all kinds of groovy topics (that have been featuring in my books) with some of my Monroe County friends of the past 35 years!

Along with Peter Hale (of the Allen Ginsberg Estate), I'm touring across England, Ireland and France discussing my new Allen Ginsberg anthology - there's still time to see us in London, Dublin, Leeds and Paris! see below for dates and venues

I'm the author of a new visual history of Allen Ginsberg - covering his life with fellow Beats: Kerouac, Burroughs, Corso - his interactions with McCartney, Dylan, Lou Reed, the Clash, Van Morrison - AND myself and Peter Hale of the Ginsberg Estate are coming to London, Leeds, Dublin and Paris !

Rizzoli Bookstore at 1133 Broadway presents: Live from New York, it's Allen Ginsberg! with Pat Thomas, Peter Hale, Holly George-Warren, Sylvia Reed Wednesday January 31st at 6 pm in Manhattan Thomas will play several rare Ginsberg recordings followed by a discussion with Hale, George-Warren, Reed about Allen and the Beats legacy, their influence on the punk/new wave scene and more.

just a reminder - this is this week! as the author of books about the Black Panthers and Jerry Rubin - both of whom were politically birthed in the San Francisco Bay Area AND now as the author of an Allen Ginsberg book (who was artistically born in the Bay) - it brings me divine pleasure to bring my journey (discussing Allen Ginsberg and the Beat Generation) City Lights Books in San Francisco (ground zero for the West Coast counterculture) on Wed Jan 24th at 7 pm AND Thur Jan 25th 7pm at Mrs. Dolloways Books 2904 College Avenue Berkeley.

attention: citizens of Los Angeles - I'm bringing my Allen Ginsberg book to Stories Books & Cafe on Thursday January 18th at 7:00PM: 1716 Sunset Blvd, 90026 I will be joined by Peter Hale (of the Ginsberg Estate) and the book's editor: Jon Klages. We will be engaging in some Beat discussion and I'll be playing some unique recordings by Allen. this is a FREE event and books will be for sale.

From the author of Listen Whitey! The sounds of Black Power 1965-1975 and Did It! Jerry Rubin: An American Revolutionary comes the next installment in Pat Thomas’ chronicling of the counterculture. Material Wealth: Mining the Personal Archive of Allen Ginsberg will be published by Powerhouse Books (distributed by Simon & Schuster) on December 1, 2023. The book is a visual treasure-trove of previously unpublished historical paperwork, vintage graphics, photographs, and ephemera that documents Ginsberg’s life experiences as a young man, breakaway poet, expansive spirit, curious intellectual traveler, and a relentless enthusiast of provocative yet spiritual pursuits of writing, art, music and culture. More than just an exploration of Ginsberg’s personal ephemera – it includes Allen’s interactions with Bob Dylan, Jerry Rubin and the Yippies, Paul McCartney, Patti Smith, Diane di Prima, Amiri Baraka, Arthur Russell, Jack Kerouac, Neal Cassady, William Burroughs, Norman Mailer, Terry Southern, and even Henry Kissinger! Poet and close friend of Allen; Anne Waldman wrote the introduction to Material Wealth.
